intro: Aristida annua, commonly known as annual dropseed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that are typically green to reddish in color. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in open fields, prairies, and disturbed areas. Aristida annua is adapted to full sun and is drought-tolerant, making it a resilient species in various ecological settings.
